abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Highway Reconstruction
            Project has been designed to arrest the serious
            deterioration of Chile's major north-south road link
            (the Longitudinal Highway), main transversal roads and other
            selected roads and bridges through the reconstruction,
            rehabilitation or periodic maintenance of the affected
            sections. It includes: (i) reconstruction and, in a few
            cases, widening of about 600 km of badly deteriorated main
            paved highways; (ii) periodic maintenance of about 1,400 km
            of selected sections of main roads; (iii) construction or
            rehabilitation of about 85 highway bridges; and (iv)
            purchase of road maintenance vehicles and other equipment.
            The project would also include consulting services to help
            the Government coordinate and supervise the project works,
            to strengthen its planning and management systems for road
            and bridge rehabilitation and maintenance, and to prepare
            preinvestment studies and an analysis of transport sector issues.
